CatDescriptText: David Barnett, operator of the Allegheny County Sanitary Authority, 7026 Hermitage Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "No, only during emergencies. Then they should be compensated.  Also, there should be more police hired to keep them from working overtime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of David Barnett wearing fedora, moustache, and diamond patterned tie with tie clip, standing on sidewalk in front of store, possibly Jenkins Arcade, Downtown
